Warlock.synopsis:
However this scene plays out, the warlock is enigmatic and self-assured - she saves players and then departs, hinting toward the help that her master can offer in other similar situations.Players have been captured by the goblin priestess and could not escape their chains. After they rest, the priestess returns to see if they've transformed into mind flayers (as she expected) and is disappointed to see they haven't. She intends to kill them, but a warlock intervenes and saves the players, killing the priestess.

The warlock has been sent by its master, a cambion called The Monitor, who players may have met already.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The 'Warlock' session presents a scenario where players are saved by a warlock who is sent by her master. The nature of the warlock's intervention suggests that it is a consequential event that occurs after the players have been captured by the goblin priestess. Since players need to be in a captured state for the warlock to save them, this indicates a clear order: the players must first be captured before the 'Warlock' session can occur. Therefore, the 'Warlock' session depends on a preceding event of being captured, which can be referenced as a trigger.

Warlock_15.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock_15.text: Open your peepers, freak. It's time.
Warlock_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: player waking up - blinking, seeing priestess standing right before them, leaning in closeNodeContext: speaking to player who is captive, in chains - they've been resting and she's waking them

Warlock_47.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock_47.text: You should be sprouting tentacles by now, but you're still the same kind of ugly you always was.

Warlock_10.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock_10.text: Disappointing not to have my own squiddie... but your giblets'll make for a tasty supper.

Warlock_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player

Warlock_24.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_24.text: Sorry - I may have left that a little late. No lasting damage, I hope?
Warlock_24.context: NodeContext: brushing herself down after killing a goblin priestess - apologetic, amused. speaking to a chained player she just rescued

Warlock_55.speaker: Player
Warlock_55.text: I'm still breathing, at least. Thank you.

Warlock_61.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_61.text: It's my master you should thank. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

Warlock_4.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_4.text: You'll meet him soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

Warlock_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: The warlock opens the chains with magic - a simple gesture like a finger click rather than complicated casting is good

Warlock_37.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_37.text: You'll meet him again soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

Warlock_34.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_34.text: You made quite an impression on my master - he sends his regards.

Warlock_22.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_22.text: My master has been keeping a close eye on you. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

Warlock_8.speaker: Player
Warlock_8.text: Could you get me out of these chains?

Warlock_32.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_32.text: And before you thank me - save your breath.

Warlock_29.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_29.text: You'll meet my master soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

Warlock_3.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_3.text: In the meantime, try not to get yourself killed. I won't always be watching.
Warlock_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~She vanishes back into her portal with a cheeky waveNodeContext: slightly mocking, but good-natured

Warlock_43.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_43.text: You'll meet my master again soon, and have a chance to show your gratitude.

Warlock_48.speaker: Player
Warlock_48.text: Your master? Who might that be?

Warlock_46.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_46.text: The honourable Raphael. He's terribly excited about you... and your condition.
Warlock_46.context: NodeContext: trying to entice us, tickling our curiosity

Warlock_1.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_1.text: An observer. He's curious about you... and your condition.
Warlock_1.context: NodeContext: trying to entice us, tickling our curiosity

Warlock_28.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_28.text: At this point, you're more interesting alive than dead. So here I am, your saviour in times of need.

Warlock_19.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_19.text: Be a little more careful. That skin's valuable, and we won't always be watching.
Warlock_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[dupe] She vanishes back into her portal with a cheeky wave

Warlock_39.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_39.text: At this point, you're more interesting alive than dead. So here I am, your saviour in times of need.

Warlock_62.speaker: Player
Warlock_62.text: A warlock? Pass your master a message: shove off.

Warlock_58.speaker: Player
Warlock_58.text: Raphael's warlock? Pass him a message: shove off.

Warlock_25.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_25.text: That's hardly how you should speak of your saviour.
Warlock_25.context: NodeContext: scolding but with a smile

Warlock_54.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_54.text: Besides - you can convey your message in person. You'll meet him soon enough.

Warlock_5.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_5.text: Besides - you can convey your message in person. You'll meet him again soon enough.

Warlock_45.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_45.text: No lasting damage, I hope? You're Zariel's little pet, if I'm not mistaken.

Warlock_11.speaker: Player
Warlock_11.text: Not anymore. If you're here to take me back, I'll kill you.

Warlock_35.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_35.text: Kill me? I don't think so. You can't even wriggle out of those chains.

Warlock_9.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_9.text: Oh, please. There's not a devil in the Hells that doesn't know Zariel's favourite has become a fugitive.

Warlock_23.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_23.text: I must say, seeing the infamous Demonsbane at the mercy of a goblin is very disappointing.

Warlock_51.speaker: Player
Warlock_51.text: Does your kind master have a name?

Warlock_36.speaker: Player
Warlock_36.text: Get an eyeful. It won't happen again.

Warlock_60.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_60.text: Don't worry. My master sent me to help.

Warlock_52.speaker: Player
Warlock_52.text: Believe me, the goblin's the least of my worries.

Warlock_31.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_31.text: I know all about your situation... your condition. My master has taken a personal interest.

Warlock_16.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_16.text: You already met him - the honourable Raphael. He's terribly excited about you... and your condition.

Warlock_6.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock_6.text: You haven't met him yet. But you will. Soon.
